<<<<<<< HEAD
A mirrhor mete for all mothers, matrones, and maidens, intituled the Mirrhor of Modestie no lesse profitable and pleasant, then necessarie to bee read and practiced. Salter, Thomas.
[35] leaves
[By J. Kingston] for Edward White, at the little Northdore of Paules at the signe of the Gun, Imprinted at London : [1579]
By Thomas Salter. Signatures: A-D E⁴[-E4]. Printer's name and publication date from STC. Includes: A pretie pithie dialogue betwene Mercurie, &c. Vertue. Made by T.S., with caption title. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
